intro: Chaetochlamys, commonly known as the "horsehair plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of a dense cluster of small, hairy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its name derives from the fine, horsehair-like filaments that surround the flower heads. Chaetochlamys species are often used in traditional medicine and horticulture due to their ornamental value and adaptability.
